channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken and dislodged paving slabs, 24th January
item.description:
A number of paving slabs have been broken and dislodged after a Selco lorry delivered building materials on the morning of Saturday 24 January.

item.title: Huge potholes on whole road but one that has damaged my car, 24th January
item.description:
I drive this road most days and you have ignored the huge pothole that is damaging peoples cars , you can’t avoid it as the road is so narrow and there is another one on the opposite side so an accident will occur when two oncoming vehicles try to avoid the crator sized hole in the road. This has damaged my vehicle so need to know how to claim as it had already been reported so you are liable
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashfield Lane, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car left in dangerous place, 24th January
item.description:
This car has been recently reported but deemed as "no further action". Can I please stress similar to whoever reported it previously that a) the car is partially damaged and b) left for weeks already at a risky place, difficult to see in dark and rainy conditions and clearly presents a traffic hazard. If the council cannot take further action, please, advise who can.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Elmstead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegally parks on double yellow weekly, 24th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elverson Road, Deptford, Greater London

item.title: Flytipping spilling onto street, 24th January
